sen.j: 田村 成義（たむら なりよし、嘉永4年2月9日 (旧暦)（1851年3月11日） - 大正9年（1920年）11月8日）は、歌舞伎劇場の興行主で、田村将軍と異名を取った人物。
sen.e: Nariyoshi TAMURA (March 11, 1851 - November 8, 1920) was a manager for a Kabuki Theater and was also called Shogun Tamura.
Nariyoshi TAMURA (March 11, 1851 - November 8, 1920) was a show manager for kabuki theaters and was given the nickname of 'Tamura Shogun' (Shogun Tamura).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Nariyoshi TAMURA (March 11, 1851 - November 8, 1920) was a show manager for kabuki theaters and was given the nickname of 'Tamura Shogun' (Shogun Tamura).

sen.j: 江戸日本橋元大工町で医師の福井家に生まれ、牢屋敷同心鍵番を勤めた田村金太郎の養子となる。
sen.e: He was born in Doctor Fukui's family in Daiku-cho, Nihonbashi, Edo (Tokyo) and was adopted by Kintaro TAMURA who was a prison security officer.
sen.cmt: 「牢屋敷同心鍵番」を'prison security officer'と訳しました。定訳は不明です。
sen.e: He was born in a doctor family, the Fukui family of Daiku-cho, Nihonbashi, Edo (Tokyo) and adopted by a prison guard Kintaro TAMURA.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He was born in a doctor family, the Fukui family of Daiku-cho, Nihonbashi, Edo (Tokyo) and adopted by a prison guard Kintaro TAMURA.

sen.j: 幼名は鋳之助。
sen.e: His childhood name was Inosuke.
His childhood name was Inosuke.
His childhood name was Inosuke.

sen.j: 改名の時期は不明。
sen.e: The date of his name change was unknown.
The year he changed his name is unknown.
The year he changed his name is unknown.

sen.j: 1869年か1870年に東京府の囚人取調係を辞職。
sen.e: He resigned from his job as a prisoner inspector of Tokyo Prefecture either in 1869 or 1870.
He resigned from his post as prisoner inspector of Tokyo Prefecture either in 1869 or in 1870.
He resigned from his post as prisoner inspector of Tokyo Prefecture either in 1869 or in 1870.

sen.j: 芝居の小道具の刀の請負い、製茶業者などの職を経たのち法律を学び、1877年代言人（弁護士）免許を得る。
sen.e: After having a rental business for swords used for plays and working in the tea industry, he studied law and received a lawyer license in 1877.
After carrying on a sword rental business for theaters and a tea making business, he studied law and received a lawyer's license in 1877.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: After carrying on a sword rental business for theaters and a tea making business, he studied law and received a lawyer's license in 1877.

sen.j: その後、新富座の十二代目守田勘弥の法律顧問になった。
sen.e: He became a legal advisor for Kanya MORITA, the 12th director of the Shintomi-za Kabuki theater.
After that, he became a legal advisor for Kanya MORITA, the 12th director of the Shintomi-za Kabuki Theater.
After that, he became a legal advisor for Kanya MORITA, the 12th director of the Shintomi-za Kabuki Theater.

sen.j: 1883年7月自由党に入党。
sen.e: He joined the Liberal Party in July 1883.
He joined the Liberal Party in July 1883.
He joined the Liberal Party in July 1883.

sen.j: 関与の程度・活動期間は不明。
sen.e: The length of time and the amount of involvement he had in this party were unknown.
How far and how long he was involved in the party are unknown.
How far and how long he was involved in the party are unknown.

sen.j: この時期銀座と横浜で代言人事務所を開く。
sen.e: At that time, he opened law offices in Ginza, Tokyo and Yokohama City.
During that period, he opened law offices in Ginza and in Yokohama.
During that period, he opened law offices in Ginza and in Yokohama.

sen.j: 尾上菊五郎 (5代目)と親交が深く、1886年菊五郎が明治座に移った際、経営に関わり、「四千両小判梅葉」などの作品の制作にも関係する。
sen.e: He formed a good relationship with Kikugoro ONOE Ⅴ and when Kikugoro moved to the Meiji-za Kabuki Theater, he became Kikugoro's manager and got involved in the production of Masterpieces including 'Shisenryo Koban no Umenoha'.

He formed a good relationship with Kikugoro ONOE (the fifth) and when Kikugoro moved to the Meiji-za Kabuki Theater in 1886, he became involved in the management of the theater and also participated in production of plays including 'Shisenryo Koban no Umenoha.'
sen.cmt: 誤訳、数字漏れがあります。
sen.e: He formed a good relationship with Kikugoro ONOE (the fifth) and when Kikugoro moved to the Meiji-za Kabuki Theater in 1886, he became involved in the management of the theater and also participated in production of plays including 'Shisenryo Koban no Umenoha.'

sen.j: 1889年11月歌舞伎座開業以降、福地桜痴・千葉勝五郎らとともに、興行主任などの名義で経営に参加した。
sen.e: After the Kabukiza Theater was opened, he was involved in management under the name of the show master etc, together with Ochi FUKUCHI and Katsugoto CHIBA.

After the Kabuki-za Theater's open in November of 1889, he was involved in the management of the theater under the name of the chief show master and so on, together with Ochi FUKUCHI and Katsugoto CHIBA.

After the Kabuki-za Theater's open in November of 1889, he was involved in the management of the theater under the name of the chief show master and so on, together with Ochi FUKUCHI and Katsugoto CHIBA.

sen.j: 1895年、弁護士の登録を取り消す。
sen.e: He cancelled his lawyer registration in 1895.
He cancelled his lawyer registration in 1895.
He cancelled his lawyer registration in 1895.

sen.j: これ以降は劇場の興行制作・経営に専念した。
sen.e: After that, he committed himself deeply into show production and management of the theater.
After that, he committed himself deeply into show production and management of the theater.
After that, he committed himself deeply into show production and management of the theater.

sen.j: 1908年以降市村座の経営権も得て、1913年、歌舞伎座が松竹の経営に移ると、田村は市村座に専念することになった。
sen.e: He also obtained the managing right of the Ichimura-za Theater in 1908 and when the Kabuki-za Theater went under the management of Shochiku Co. Ltd., Tamura decided to concentrate on the Ichimura-za Theater.

He also obtained the managing right of the Ichimura-za Theater in 1908, and after the Kabuki-za Theater went under the management of Matsutake Gomei Sha (present Shochiku Co., Ltd.), Tamura concentrate on the management of the Ichimura-za Theater.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞の説明を補います。
sen.e: He also obtained the managing right of the Ichimura-za Theater in 1908, and after the Kabuki-za Theater went under the management of Matsutake Gomei Sha (present Shochiku Co., Ltd.), Tamura concentrate on the management of the Ichimura-za Theater.

sen.j: 市村座では若手の尾上菊五郎 (6代目)や中村吉右衛門 (初代)らを抜擢して育て、人気を博した。
sen.e: At the Ichimura-za Theater, he picked and raised Kikugoro ONOE Ⅵ and Kichiemon NAKAMURA and the theater became highly popular.
At the Ichimura-za Theater, he selected and trained Kikugoro ONOE (the sixth) and Kichiemon NAKAMURA, and the theater became highly popular.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: At the Ichimura-za Theater, he selected and trained Kikugoro ONOE (the sixth) and Kichiemon NAKAMURA, and the theater became highly popular.

sen.j: 帝国劇場や歌舞伎座を向こうに回し、いわゆる「菊吉時代」「二長町時代」を築いた。
sen.e: He built the 'Age of Kiku-Yoshi' (age of Kikugoro and Kichiemon) and the 'Age of Nichomachi (the name of the town where the theater was)' against the Teikoku Theater and the Kabuki-za Theater.

He built the so-called 'Kiku-Kichi Jidai' (the age of Kikugoro and Kichiemon) and 'Nicho-machi Jidai' (the age of Nicho-machi [the town the theater was located) against the Teikoku-gekijo Theater and the Kabuki-za Theater.
sen.cmt: 「菊吉」は「きくきち」、固有名詞読み間違いがあります。
sen.e: He built the so-called 'Kiku-Kichi Jidai' (the age of Kikugoro and Kichiemon) and 'Nicho-machi Jidai' (the age of Nicho-machi [the town the theater was located) against the Teikoku-gekijo Theater and the Kabuki-za Theater.

sen.j: 趣味は小唄で、小唄田村流の祖の田村てると親交があった。
sen.e: One of his hobbies was Kouta (a form of short song) and he became friends with Teru TAMURA, the founder of the Tamura school of Kouta.
One of his hobbies was Kouta (a form of short song) and he became friends with Teru TAMURA, the founder of the Tamura school of Kouta.
One of his hobbies was Kouta (a form of short song) and he became friends with Teru TAMURA, the founder of the Tamura school of Kouta.

sen.j: 腎臓炎のため1920年逝去。
sen.e: He died of a kidney infection.
He died of a kidney infection.
He died of a kidney infection.

sen.j: 市村座は田村の死後、子の田村寿二郎（成義を大田村、寿二郎を小田村と呼んだ）が経営に当たったが、吉右衛門、七代目坂東三津五郎らが相次いで脱退したため、次第に衰退していった（1928年市村座は松竹経営になったが1932年に焼失し、再建されなかった）。
sen.e: After Tamura's death, his son Toshijiro TAMURA (Nariyoshi was called Big Tamura and Toshijiro was called Little Tamura) took over management, because Kichiemon and Mitsugoro BANDO Ⅶ left, the Ichimura-za Theater gradually lost its appeal and declined (The Ichimura-za Theater went under the management of Shochiku Co., Ltd. in 1928 but when it was burnt down in 1932, they did not rebuild it.)

After Tamura's death, his son Toshijiro TAMURA took over the management (Nariyoshi was called Otamura [Big Tamura] and Toshijiro was called Shotamura [Little Tamura], however, because Kichiemon and Mitsugoro BANDO (the seventh) left the theater, the Ichimura-za Theater gradually lost its appeal and declined (in 1928 the Ichimura-za Theater went under the management of Matsutake, however after it was burnt down in 1932, it was not rebuild).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: After Tamura's death, his son Toshijiro TAMURA took over the management (Nariyoshi was called Otamura [Big Tamura] and Toshijiro was called Shotamura [Little Tamura], however, because Kichiemon and Mitsugoro BANDO (the seventh) left the theater, the Ichimura-za Theater gradually lost its appeal and declined (in 1928 the Ichimura-za Theater went under the management of Matsutake, however after it was burnt down in 1932, it was not rebuild).

sen.j: 続々歌舞伎年代記 乾（1922年） 「歌舞伎年代記」（立川焉馬）、「続歌舞伎年代記」（豊芥子）の続編で、幕末から明治中期を扱う。
sen.e: "Zokuzoku Kabuki Nendaiki Ken (First Book)" (Third series of Kabuki chronicle): As a sequel of 'Kabuki Nendaiki' (Kabuki chronicle) (by Enba TACHIKAWA) and 'Zoku Kabuki Nendaiki' (Second Kabuki chronicle) (by Hokaishi), this book is dealing from the end of Edo period to the mid Meiji period.

"Zokuzoku Kabuki Nendaiki, Ken" (A sequel to the Sequel to Kabuki Chronicle, the first volume) in 1922: As a sequel to "Kabuki Nendaiki" (Kabuki Chronicle) by Enba TATEKAWA and to "Zoku Kabuki Nendaiki" (The Sequel to Kabuki Chronicle) by Hokaishi, this book includes the reputations of Kabuki from the end of the Edo period to the middle of the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違い、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: "Zokuzoku Kabuki Nendaiki, Ken" (A sequel to the Sequel to Kabuki Chronicle, the first volume) in 1922: As a sequel to "Kabuki Nendaiki" (Kabuki Chronicle) by Enba TATEKAWA and to "Zoku Kabuki Nendaiki" (The Sequel to Kabuki Chronicle) by Hokaishi, this book includes the reputations of Kabuki from the end of the Edo period to the middle of the Meiji period.

sen.j: さらにさらに「坤」として明治37年から大正9年までの原稿を用意していたが、原稿を用意していたが関東大震災のため焼失した。
sen.e: He also wrote a draft for 'Ko' the (second) book for the time between 1904 and 1920, but it was burnt at the Great Kanto Earthquake.
sen.cmt: 原稿から『「坤」として』を追加
sen.e: He also prepared a draft for 'Kon' (the second volume) including the reputations of kabuki from 1904 to 1920, however it was burnt at the Great Kanto Earthquake.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違い、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He also prepared a draft for 'Kon' (the second volume) including the reputations of kabuki from 1904 to 1920, however it was burnt at the Great Kanto Earthquake.

sen.j: 芸界通信無線電話（青蛙房、1975年）
sen.e: "Geino Tsushin Musen Denwa" (a script in which a person calls heaven and talks to them on the phone) (Seiabo Publishing, 1975)
sen.cmt: ウェブサイトより追加しました。
sen.e: "Geikai Tsushin Musen Denwa" (Correspondences with Show Business by Radiophone) (Seiabo Publishing, 1975)
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違い、訳語選択ミスがあります。この追加は必要なのか疑問です。
sen.e: "Geikai Tsushin Musen Denwa" (Correspondences with Show Business by Radiophone) (Seiabo Publishing, 1975)
